title: The Intelligent Scouting Archive
summary: Built a scouting assistant that centralizes hard-to-find European university basketball data. Mixed-method research informed a workflow that continuously discovers, enriches, and updates player records for recruiters.
highlights: AI prompt engineering for niche sources

hero.title: The Intelligent Scouting Archive
hero.subtitle: Helping recruiters surface hidden European university talent with a research-driven workflow.
hero.summary: I built a full-stack prototype that scrapes fragmented tournament sources, enriches player profiles with AI, and surfaces signals scouts care about most.

overview.title: Scouting in the shadows of collegiate data
overview.description: U.S. collegiate scouting is data rich, but European university leagues remain scattered across PDFs, livestream descriptions, and social clips. The archive aggregates these sources into a structured, queryable system.
highlights: Synthesized interviews with six active scouts to understand decision frameworks.
Modeled a content pipeline that scores source reliability and freshness.
Shipped a responsive interface that mirrors scouts' real evaluation stages.

media.alt: Interface mockups for the intelligent scouting archive

challenge.title: Hidden players, inconsistent data, urgent timelines
challenge.description: Scouts needed a way to monitor lesser-known prospects without manually digging through dozens of temporary tournament sites every week.
list: Player stats disappear after short-lived tournaments.
No central view of verified heights, positions, or availability.
Scouts spend hours rewriting the same outreach summaries.

solution.title: An end-to-end workflow that learns with scouts
solution.description: The system continuously discovers prospects, enriches their profiles, and highlights the most actionable players each week.

media.alt: Workflow diagram for the scouting archive

steps.title: Research foundation
steps.description: Interviews uncovered that manual data collection, not analysis, consumed the most time, so automation needed to focus there.

steps.title: Data architecture
steps.description: Structured a schema linking game logs, biometric data, and qualitative notes to keep every profile actionable.

steps.title: Assistive interface
steps.description: Built a Tailwind UI that lets scouts triage prospects, compare trajectories, and export outreach-ready briefs.

modules.title: Source monitoring
modules.description: Serverless jobs ping niche federation feeds and upload cleaned box scores into the archive nightly.

modules.title: AI synopsis
modules.description: Prompt chains summarize player potential, flag inconsistencies, and cite original sources for auditability.

modules.title: Scouting board
modules.description: A kanban-inspired triage view organizes prospects by readiness and confidence signals.

impact.title: From manual digging to proactive scouting
impact.description: Testing with two scouts showed the archive shaved hours from weekly prep and surfaced previously overlooked prospects.
results: Interview participants reported trusting the AI summaries thanks to transparent citations.
Built-in outreach briefs accelerated how quickly scouts contacted players and coaches.
Automated freshness scoring highlighted stale data before it hurt recommendations.

interaction.title: Interface moments tailored for recruiters
interaction.description: Designed micro-patterns that keep scouts in flow even when toggling between desktop and mobile contexts.

cards.title: Trajectory sparkline
cards.description: Each profile visualizes performance trends across tournaments, color-coded by competition strength.

cards.title: Outreach composer
cards.description: One-click briefs compile stats, narratives, and contact info into scout-branded templates.

cards.title: Freshness alerts
cards.description: Subscribers receive notifications when new footage or verified measurements appear.

process.title: Applied mixed-methods research
process.description: Every sprint balanced qualitative insight with data validation to ensure the tool mirrored real scouting decisions.

sections.title: 1. Map the job-to-be-done
sections.description: Affinity mapping the interviews revealed bottlenecks in discovery, validation, and storytelling.

findings.title: Discovery debt
findings.description: Scouts spent 60% of their time finding stats, not evaluating them.

findings.title: Signal drift
findings.description: Without consistent structure, promising players fell through the cracks after two weeks.

sections.title: 2. Prototype data flows
sections.description: I mapped how raw feeds become ranked recommendations, validating logic with subject matter experts.

steps.title: Source inventory
steps.description: Catalogued federation feeds, livestream chats, and stat PDFs.

steps.title: Scoring model
steps.description: Weighted prospect potential using recency and competition level.

steps.title: Usability cycles
steps.description: Ran weekly walkthroughs to test triage interactions.

cards.title: Experiment: RAG prompts
cards.description: Fine-tuned prompt templates so scouts could audit AI-generated summaries with citations.

cards.title: Experiment: Confidence bands
cards.description: Visualized statistical confidence to align expectations before outreach calls.

conclusion.title: What I learned
conclusion.description: Building the archive reinforced that trustworthy AI tools require pairing automation with transparent research artifacts.
